content:
I've also written up a proposed change to the 'Summary' tab for profiles, logical models and extension definitions. Note - this change will affect all IGs and will be extremely difficult to make configurable, so ideally I'd like unanimous consent to making the change. Feedback here or in Git.
https://github.com/HL7/ig-template-base/issues/161.
when would this be implemented? (I think making the differential the default could be done asap)
I haven't got things organized in terms of vetting process yet - so probably early July.
So what I am hearing is we can't just make this change without formally approval from newly formed WG?
I think it's reasonable to put that WG/process in the way here. This not being an urgent thing, a richer backlog helps make the case for a good process
It's not a new WG - it's a new project. Given that it's going to affect everyone - and there's no easy way to make it toggleable, I do think we need a broad consensus around the change.
we got 6 :thumbs_up: on the git page
I'm not sure that's the bar. I probably would have got 6 thumbs-up on next/prev links too, depending who was paying attention.

We discussed this today and are in agreement about making the change. The only question outstanding is the appropriate new name for the summary tab. Proposed name is "Stats and Refs", but we're soliciting alternative names.
We agreed that the 'summary' part wasn't useful? So then, why not just call it 'References'?

If we're going to drop the stats bit, I'm fine with that. We might also add a few more sets of references:

  • this profile uses the following other profiles
  • this profile is used in the following other profiles
    (However doing that would be managed under a separate tracker)
the first is already in the summary. The second is already a fragment waiting for inclusion

Based on further discussion, the proposal has been updated. Details here: https://github.com/HL7/ig-template-base/issues/161
Gist: rename "Summary" to "References", move it to second last tab, add "where is this structure referenced from" to the set of references it already exposes.
Feedback welcome. If no one objects, we'll look to approve next week.
